pageContext.description: Bronze sword of Hallstatt type in good condition. Nine rivets with "cap & pimple" heads. Two rivet holes at extreme broken end of hilt. Slight bend about 7 ins. from end of blade.
pageContext.patina: Dull bronze with large areas of black particularly on and near hilt. Some recent scraping on both faces.
pageContext.collection: Viscountess Gage,Submitted by Mr. Anthony H. Packe,Tile House,Dropmore Road,Burnham, Bucks.,August 1953
pageContext.site: England,Buckinghamshire,Taplow (Thames at),See also preceding card - apparently same sword.
pageContext.remarks: Presented to Lord Desborough (Lady Gage's father) by the Conservators of the River Thames.,Dredged up in 1936
